meanings.definition: Oppugners: those who oppose or attack
meanings.sent1: The oppugners gathered to protest against the new law.
meanings.sent2: The oppugners clashed with the supporters during the demonstration.
meanings.sent3: The oppugners decided to have a peaceful debate instead of a physical fight.
meanings.sent4: The oppugners' arguments were like arrows, piercing through the opposing side's defenses.
meanings.sent5: The image of the oppugners standing firm in their beliefs stayed in my mind.

meanings.sent1: I oppugn the decision made by the council.
meanings.sent2: She oppugners any form of discrimination.
meanings.sent3: The siblings oppugners each other playfully in a game of chess.
meanings.sent4: His words oppugners the very foundation of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The hero oppugners the villain with courage and determination.

meanings.sent1: The oppugners army launched a fierce attack on the enemy.
meanings.sent2: Her oppugners remarks caused a stir in the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The oppugners forces were relentless in their pursuit of victory.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered like oppugners ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The oppugners winds howled through the night, signaling an impending storm.
